question_stem: What is the name of the R function for printing statements to the console, without any other side effect (e.g. returning a string object)?
question_stem_html: What is the name of the R function for printing statements to the console, without any other side effect (e.g. returning a string object)?

items.part_stem: What is the name of the R function for printing statements to the console, without any other side effect (e.g. returning a string object)?
items.part_stem_html: What is the name of the R function for printing statements to the console, without any other side effect (e.g. returning a string object)?
items.solution:
In R, the print function will return an object. Try this:
x 
x

paste( ) is for combining and returning strings. Here is an example:
x 
x

sink is for redirecting output to a file. The command shown will redirect output to a file named "console".
items.solution_html:
In R, the print function will return an object. Try this:

x <- print("Hello world")

x

paste( ) is for combining and returning strings. Here is an example:

x <- paste("Hello", "world")

x

sink is for redirecting output to a file. The command shown will redirect output to a file named "console".
